alert.note: Alert for West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 09 at 2:59PM MST until March 11 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW POSSIBLE IN THE HIGH COUNTRY FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY... .A storm system is expected to bring heavy snow to the north central mountains of Colorado starting late Friday morning and continue through Saturday afternoon. The heaviest snowfall is expected to occur in the Park and Gore Ranges, the I-70 corridor will also be affected. The combination of heavy snow and gusty winds will cause poor visibility and difficult travel conditions. Weekend mountain travel will be impacted. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM FRIDAY TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 12 and 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...The Park and Gore Ranges, including Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...From 5 AM Friday to 5 PM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Snow covered roads will make travel hazardous. Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.

area.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
